instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
MacBook came in with fake charger, <RESISTOR>R6920</RESISTOR> was burned, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <CHIP>U4650</CHIP> were shorted, those got replaced, but still no light on charger. One thing I cannot figure out is why <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> shows OL and on a working board I get 0.678 when measuring in diode mode. <RESISTOR>R7045</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> are both good, from there I don't know where to go.

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Possibly <RESISTOR>R6912</RESISTOR> burnt, damaged in same way; you must check ohm scale, onboard.
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> not present at all?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Thanks, weird enough I removed <RESISTOR>R6912</RESISTOR> measured it and it was fine, put it back on and now I got <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>, but on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> I am only getting 12.2v, <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> is fine, will check SMC now.

BTY I still don't have a light on the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Ok first reflowed SMC and same thing, then I replaced it and board is now working fine, all of this because of a knockoff charger...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: New SMC fixed the problem, I will keep that in mind for next time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Fake charger delivers always full voltage.
If you connect the Magsafe a bit angled, <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> pin can receive an overvoltage.
Original Magsafe 2 charger delivers 3V aprox, with very low current capability.
Full voltage is enabled if charger doesn't detect any short, or leakage...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
